channel.title: MS Dev Show
channel.description: THE podcast for Microsoft developers. Jason and Carl talk about the latest in developer news covering topics such as the cloud and cross-platform development using the Microsoft platform.
channel.itunes:author: Jason Young & Carl Schweitzer
channel.itunes:summary: THE podcast for Microsoft developers. Jason Young and Carl Schweitzer talk about the latest in developer news covering topics such as the Azure cloud, Windows, Windows Phone, Visual Studio, and cross-platform development using the Microsoft platform.
channel.itunes:subtitle: The Microsoft Developer Show

item.title: Soft Skills with John Sonmez
item.description: This week we talk to John Sonmez about all the details software developers didn't learn in school. Creating a DMZ in Azure, and the Joel test for Programmers.
item.itunes:subtitle: This week we talk to John Sonmez about all the details software developers didn't learn in school. Creating a DMZ in Azure, and the Joel test for Programmers.

item.title: ASP.NET 5 and More with Scott Hanselman
item.description: Welcome to the MS Dev Show, episode #43. This week we talk to Scott Hanselman about ASP.NET 5, community, and more. The best new Windows phone 10 features in 6 gifs. And You don't know JS, the book.
item.itunes:subtitle: Welcome to the MS Dev Show, episode #43. This week we talk to Scott Hanselman about ASP.NET 5, community, and more. The best new Windows phone 10 features in 6 gifs. And You don't know JS, the book.

item.title: Raygun with John-Daniel Trask
item.description: We talk to John-Daniel Trask about how to track exceptions in your application with Raygun. The modern version of office. The Azure cloud platform roadmap. A Raspberry Pi 2 running Windows 10.
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk to John-Daniel Trask about how to track exceptions in your application with Raygun. The modern version of office. The Azure cloud platform roadmap. A Raspberry Pi 2 running Windows 10.

item.title: Websites, Kudu, and WebJobs with David Ebbo
item.description: We talk to David Ebbo about websites, Kudu, WebJobs, and what makes them tick. Coding an elevator with JavaScript. Live coding a JavaScript game from scratch on stage.
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk to David Ebbo about websites, Kudu, WebJobs, and what makes them tick. Coding an elevator with JavaScript. Live coding a JavaScript game from scratch on stage.

item.title: DevOps with Steven Murawski
item.description: We talk to Steven Murawski about his experience practicing DevOps at stack exchange and Chef. We also talk about the Windows 10 announcement. Did they just announce freaking holograms?
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk to Steven Murawski about his experience practicing DevOps at stack exchange and Chef. We also talk about the Windows 10 announcement. Did they just announce freaking holograms?

item.title: MVVM Light with Laurent Bugnion
item.description: We talk with Laurent Bugnion about MVVM Light. Applying NASA coding standards to JavaScript. Roslyn is moving to GitHub. Can a computer be racist?
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk with Laurent Bugnion about MVVM Light. Applying NASA coding standards to JavaScript. Roslyn is moving to GitHub. Can a computer be racist?

item.title: Azure Stream Analytics with Janet Yeilding
item.description: We talk to Janet Yeilding about Azure Stream Analytics. How StackExchange handles 560 million pageview each month. And unit tests are finally getting smarter.
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk to Janet Yeilding about Azure Stream Analytics. How StackExchange handles 560 million pageview each month. And unit tests are finally getting smarter.

item.title: News, Questions, and Asteroid Mining
item.description: Welcome to the MS Dev Show, episode #37. This week Carl and Jason talk about how to not hate JavaScript, keep your cloud keys out of GitHub, and Jason explains a shortcut to asteroid mining.
item.itunes:subtitle: Welcome to the MS Dev Show, episode #37. This week Carl and Jason talk about how to not hate JavaScript, keep your cloud keys out of GitHub, and Jason explains a shortcut to asteroid mining.

item.title: What You Need to Know about the Internet of Things
item.description: We talk with Josh Holmes to learn what you need to know about the internet of things. DRM'd cat litter, and we cry over bad password security.
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk with Josh Holmes to learn what you need to know about the internet of things. DRM'd cat litter, and we cry over bad password security.

item.title: AngularJS with John Ptacek
item.description: We talk to John Ptacek about AngularJS. Big-o notation. The worst programming language ever. Emailing hardware to outer space.
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk to John Ptacek about AngularJS. Big-o notation. The worst programming language ever. Emailing hardware to outer space.

item.title: Real Developer Potpourri with Trish Curry
item.description: We talk to Trish Curry about moving to Azure, building mobile apps with Xamarin, and data science. Forking node, top 10 mistakes node.js developers make, shaving milliseconds, and how to make sure your app is on the nice list this Christmas.
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk to Trish Curry about moving to Azure, building mobile apps with Xamarin, and data science. Forking node, top 10 mistakes node.js developers make, shaving milliseconds, and how to make sure your app is on the nice list this Christmas.

item.title: Double Your App Revenue with a Global Audience
item.description: We talk to Mattias and Jaana about the massive global opportunities for mobile apps. Artificial intelligence is now creating magic tricks. Home automation for $5.
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk to Mattias and Jaana about the massive global opportunities for mobile apps. Artificial intelligence is now creating magic tricks. Home automation for $5.

item.title: App Design for Monetization with Atley Hunter
item.description: We talk to Atley Hunter about designing your apps for monetization. SSL all the things. Cache is the new RAM. And a picture is worth a thousand words.
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk to Atley Hunter about designing your apps for monetization. SSL all the things. Cache is the new RAM. And a picture is worth a thousand words.

item.title: Getting People Excited about Technology with Anthony Russell
item.description: We talk to Anthony Russell about getting the next generation of technology enthusiasts. The Microsoft band is useful in surprising places. Http/2 all the things! Why did you write your code this way?
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk to Anthony Russell about getting the next generation of technology enthusiasts. The Microsoft band is useful in surprising places. Http/2 all the things! Why did you write your code this way?

item.title: Chocolatey with Rob Reynolds
item.description: We talk to Rob Reynolds about the sweetness of Chocolatey. .NET is on Linux and Mac. Visual Studio 2015. Microsoft makes you an offer you can't refuse.
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk to Rob Reynolds about the sweetness of Chocolatey. .NET is on Linux and Mac. Visual Studio 2015. Microsoft makes you an offer you can't refuse.

item.title: SELECT * FROM Awesome WHERE Guest = Jes Borland
item.description: We talk with Jes Borland about SQL Server. Loads of Azure announcements from TechEd Europe. Making math easy with PhotoMath.
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk with Jes Borland about SQL Server. Loads of Azure announcements from TechEd Europe. Making math easy with PhotoMath.

item.title: How to Get Your Boss to Pay for Azure with Kenny Young
item.description: We talk to Kenny Young to find out how to get your boss to pay for Azure. How to become a better programmer by googling it. Microsoft is doooooomed.
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk to Kenny Young to find out how to get your boss to pay for Azure. How to become a better programmer by googling it. Microsoft is doooooomed.

item.title: Getting Rich with Ads with Rob Irving and Simon Jackson
item.description: We talk to Rob Irving and Simon Jackson about maximizing ad performance. Where do old devs go? How do office apps share 95% of their code?
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk to Rob Irving and Simon Jackson about maximizing ad performance. Where do old devs go? How do office apps share 95% of their code?

item.title: Everything You Didn't Know about Design with Rick Barraza
item.description: We talk to Rick Barraza to learn everything we didn't know about design. Deploy to azure with the click of a button. How to mirror your screen on your TV. How to write unmaintainable code.
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk to Rick Barraza to learn everything we didn't know about design. Deploy to azure with the click of a button. How to mirror your screen on your TV. How to write unmaintainable code.

item.title: The Web is Awesome with Jeremy Foster
item.description: We discuss the awesomeness of the web with Jeremy Foster. Wow space battles actually work. The 4k programmer. And why is the NSA creating one programming language to rule them all?
item.itunes:subtitle: We discuss the awesomeness of the web with Jeremy Foster. Wow space battles actually work. The 4k programmer. And why is the NSA creating one programming language to rule them all?

item.title: Web Performance Optimization with Brian Muenzenmeyer
item.description: We talk to Brian Muenzenmeyer about web performance optimization. Possibilities of RemoteApp. Why I don't teach SOLID. Mining bitcoin with pencil and paper.
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk to Brian Muenzenmeyer about web performance optimization. Possibilities of RemoteApp. Why I don't teach SOLID. Mining bitcoin with pencil and paper.

item.title: Web Essentials & SideWaffle w/ Mads Kristensen
item.description: We talk with Mads Kristensen about web essentials, SideWaffle, and extending visual studio. Get WinJS everywhere. How to salt your passwords to get the flavor just right. Build your own authenticator.
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk with Mads Kristensen about web essentials, SideWaffle, and extending visual studio. Get WinJS everywhere. How to salt your passwords to get the flavor just right. Build your own authenticator.

item.title: Azure Mobile Services with Brandon Martinez
item.description: We talk with Brandon Martinez about his experiences using Azure Mobile Services. The new Nokia-sized iPhone. What is the killer smart watch app? Visualizing algorithms through animations. Carl won't stop talking about SideWaffle.
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk with Brandon Martinez about his experiences using Azure Mobile Services. The new Nokia-sized iPhone. What is the killer smart watch app? Visualizing algorithms through animations. Carl won't stop talking about SideWaffle.

item.title: DocumentDB with Ryan and Shireesh
item.description: We talk to Ryan and Shireesh from the document DB team about the new hosted document database option in Azure. Google shows old versions of their homepage in older browsers. John Gruber and Jeff Atwood go head to head over markdown. Microsoft plays nice.
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk to Ryan and Shireesh from the document DB team about the new hosted document database option in Azure. Google shows old versions of their homepage in older browsers. John Gruber and Jeff Atwood go head to head over markdown. Microsoft plays nice.

item.title: Real Agile in Microsoft with Justin Marks
item.description: We talk with Justin Marks about agile within Microsoft. Supercharging Visual Studio with a new Bing extension. Add Window live tiles to Chrome.
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk with Justin Marks about agile within Microsoft. Supercharging Visual Studio with a new Bing extension. Add Window live tiles to Chrome.

item.title: Azure Search with Liam Cavanagh
item.description: We talk with Liam Cavanagh about the new Azure search service. Using Gooey to turn console applications into Windows applications. Azure SQL Database goes GA. How the Napa Earthquake Affected Bay Area Sleepers.
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk with Liam Cavanagh about the new Azure search service. Using Gooey to turn console applications into Windows applications. Azure SQL Database goes GA. How the Napa Earthquake Affected Bay Area Sleepers.

item.title: Fear, Productivity, and how to Rob a Bank with Jeff Blankenburg
item.description: We talk to Jeff Blankenburg about fear, productivity, and how to rob a bank. Let's compile like it's 1992. Delete your mail while you're on vacation.
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk to Jeff Blankenburg about fear, productivity, and how to rob a bank. Let's compile like it's 1992. Delete your mail while you're on vacation.

item.title: Azure Active Directory with Marc Kuperstein
item.description: We talk with Marc Kuperstein about Azure Active Directory. Using Cortana when your phone is locked. Microsoft is dropping old versions of IE. And what ORM's have taught me - just learn SQL.
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk with Marc Kuperstein about Azure Active Directory. Using Cortana when your phone is locked. Microsoft is dropping old versions of IE. And what ORM's have taught me - just learn SQL.

item.title: Windows Phone Apps with Ambassador Lance McCarthy
item.description: We talk with Nokia Ambassador Lance McCarthy about Windows app development. An update to Windows Phone 8.1. We look back to c for programming fundamentals, and look forward to C# 6.
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk with Nokia Ambassador Lance McCarthy about Windows app development. An update to Windows Phone 8.1. We look back to c for programming fundamentals, and look forward to C# 6.

item.title: Azure Event Hubs with Dan Rosanova
item.description: We talk with Dan Rosanova about Azure Event Hubs and scaling to millions of devices. The single question for the most successful technical interview. Scaling to 560M page views each month on only 25 servers. Lots of XAML resources for building amazing apps.
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk with Dan Rosanova about Azure Event Hubs and scaling to millions of devices. The single question for the most successful technical interview. Scaling to 560M page views each month on only 25 servers. Lots of XAML resources for building amazing...

item.title: Telerik and That Conference with Clark Sell
item.description: This week we talk to Clark Sell about his new job at Telerik, "That Conference", Google is killing your laptop battery, Microsoft kills off some Nokia phones, and more!
item.itunes:subtitle: This week we talk to Clark Sell about his new job at Telerik, "That Conference", Google is killing your laptop battery, Microsoft kills off some Nokia phones, and more!

item.title: Nitrogen for IoT with Tim Park
item.description: We talk about Nitrogen.js and IoT with Tim Park. Got sweet code? Save it. The intro to reactive programming you've been missing, and why is c# suddenly so popular?
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk about Nitrogen.js and IoT with Tim Park. Got sweet code? Save it. The intro to reactive programming you've been missing, and why is c# suddenly so popular?

item.title: GitHub with Phil Haack!
item.description: This week we talk with Phil Haack about GitHub and much more! Human JavaScript, Universal Windows Apps, and 10 real world algorithms that dominate our world.
item.itunes:subtitle: This week we talk with Phil Haack about GitHub and much more! Human JavaScript, Universal Windows Apps, and 10 real world algorithms that dominate our world.

item.title: Azure with Eric D. Boyd
item.description: This week we talk Azure with Eric D. Boyd from ResponsiveX. We also cover 7 things the surface pro 3 can do better than your laptop, observable object support in JavaScript, and home automation.
item.itunes:subtitle: This week we talk Azure with Eric D. Boyd from ResponsiveX. We also cover 7 things the surface pro 3 can do better than your laptop, observable object support in JavaScript, and home automation.

item.title: WTH is IoT?
item.description: This week we ask what the heck is IoT? Video processing from a phone mounted to a car wheel. Azure ML. IE developer channel. What is a CDN? (sorry for the poor audio quality on Jason's side)
item.itunes:subtitle: This week we ask what the heck is IoT? Video processing from a phone mounted to a car wheel. Azure ML. IE developer channel. What is a CDN? (sorry for the poor audio quality on Jason's side)

item.title: Enterprise Store Apps with Greg Levenhagen
item.description: We talk with Greg Levenhagen about enterprise development. We take a look at a comparison between Swift and C#, The Share Icon that no one agrees on, Docker on Azure, and Windows is being used on the Mac Pro production line?
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk with Greg Levenhagen about enterprise development. We take a look at a comparison between Swift and C#, The Share Icon that no one agrees on, Docker on Azure, and Windows is being used on the Mac Pro production line?

item.title: BattleHack! with Anthony Russell
item.description: We talk with windows phone developer Anthony Russell about BattleHack! Also, Apple's recent WWDC announcements, optimizing SQL Server for Azure, and Azure service bus relay.
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk with windows phone developer Anthony Russell about BattleHack! Also, Apple's recent WWDC announcements, optimizing SQL Server for Azure, and Azure service bus relay.

item.title: Orleans & Thinking Outside the Box
item.description: This week we're hacking Orleans. We also talk about a novel approach to silencing the iPhone camera shutter, how apple cheats, and the Surface 3 AMA.
item.itunes:subtitle: This week we're hacking Orleans. We also talk about a novel approach to silencing the iPhone camera shutter, how apple cheats, and the Surface 3 AMA.

item.title: Top 10 Windows App Mistakes with Jason Short
item.description: We talk to Jason Short about his real world experience with the top mistakes developers make when building Windows apps. We also discuss the Surface Pro 3 annoucement.
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk to Jason Short about his real world experience with the top mistakes developers make when building Windows apps. We also discuss the Surface Pro 3 annoucement.

item.title: TechEd 2014
item.description: Our TechEd 2014 recap. We also talk about an update to Windows Phone 8.1 and good news for Windows Phone adoption.
item.itunes:subtitle: Our TechEd 2014 recap. We also talk about an update to Windows Phone 8.1 and good news for Windows Phone adoption.

item.title: Mobile Development with Jeff Weber
item.description: This week we talk to iOS and Windows Phone game developer Jeff Weber about his success to date with his fantastic game Krashlander. Jeff explains how he got into developing games and the experiences he had bringing his games to market. We also talk about Azure websites, Windows Phone news, That Conference, and congratulate Jeff and Jason on being selected as speakers.
item.itunes:subtitle: This week we talk to iOS and Windows Phone game developer Jeff Weber about his success to date with his fantastic game Krashlander. Jeff explains how he got into developing games and the experiences he had bringing his games to market. We also talk...

item.title: April 25th, 2014
item.description: Carl goes to DVLUP, embracing a hackfest culture, new sound setup, Nokia aquisition complete, MSDevShow.com is pinnable, and Azure storage options.
item.itunes:subtitle: Carl goes to DVLUP, embracing a hackfest culture, new sound setup, Nokia aquisition complete, MSDevShow.com is pinnable, and Azure storage options.

item.title: JavaScript Promises with Brandon Martinez
item.description: Jason and Carl talk about why they started the podcast. Jason gets excited about new hardware, and talks about setting up the show. We have special guest Brandon Martinez, and he talks about JavaScript promises. He was also the musical genius behind our intro music and logo.
item.itunes:subtitle: This will be Epic - I Promise

item.title: Build 2014
